citation.article-title: Taxonomy of marine Pseudomonas species: P. stanieri sp. nov., P. perfectomarina sp. nov., nom. rev.; P. nautica; and P. doudoroffii.

p.s: Description of Pseudomonas perfectomarina sp. nov., nom. rev.
Pseudomonas perfectomarina (per.fec.to.ma.ri'na L. fem. partic. perfecto perfect, complete; L. fem. adj. marina of the sea, marine; perfectomarina M. L. fem. adj. completely marine)
Straight or slightly curved rods 0.5 to 0.7 μm in width and 1.1 to 1.9 μm in length; nonmotile (Fig. 1B).

Utilizes 45 organic compounds which include D-glucose and maltose, but no other pentose, hexose, or disaccharide; utilizes fatty acids, tricarboxylic acid cycle intermediates, alcohols, and amino acids.
The mol% G+C content in the DNA is 62.
